issues.title: Consider splitting /pro:gaps into analyze and fix commands
issues.description: The current /pro:gaps command both analyzes gaps AND creates branches to fix them. Consider whether this should be two separate commands for clearer purpose: one for analysis/verification only, and one for addressing identified gaps.

issues.title: /pro:readme - No Offline Mode
issues.description: If network is unavailable, badge and link validation will fail. Currently warns user and proceeds with syntax-only checks. Could cache validation results or provide explicit offline mode flag.

issues.title: /pro:readme - No Badge Preview Images
issues.description: When proposing badges, we describe them but don't show actual rendered previews. Currently shows text descriptions. Could use terminal image rendering or generate a preview document.

issues.title: /pro:readme - No README Templates for Specific Frameworks
issues.description: Dynamic generation works well but some frameworks (Next.js, Rails, etc.) have community-standard README patterns. Currently uses generic structure adapted to project type. Could add optional framework-specific templates.

issues.title: /pro:readme - No Automated Section Ordering
issues.description: When generating sections, the order is hardcoded rather than learned from the ecosystem. Currently uses fixed section order based on common patterns. Could analyze popular repositories to determine optimal ordering.

issues.title: /pro:readme - No Diff Visualization
issues.description: Changes are described in text but not shown as an actual diff. Currently summarizes changes in categories (sections, badges, links). Could show side-by-side or unified diff format.

issues.title: /pro:readme - No CI/CD Badge Auto-Detection for all providers
issues.description: Currently checks for GitHub Actions but not all CI providers. Could detect CircleCI, Travis CI, GitLab CI, etc.
